programme.title: Black Eye
programme.desc: An ex-police officer operating a private detective business comes face to face with a syndicate-backed dope ring.

programme.title: Hot Potato
programme.desc: A karate expert (Jim Kelly) and two cohorts must save a senator's kidnapped daughter.

programme.title: Black Belt Jones
programme.desc: A martial artist (Jim Kelly) helps a father (Scatman Crothers) and daughter (Gloria Hendry) save their school of self-defense from Los Angeles mobsters.

programme.title: The Deadly Art of Survival
programme.desc: A martial arts instructor struggles with drug dealers who are operating from a rival karate school called the Disco Dojo.

programme.title: Bloodfist
programme.desc: A Los Angeles kickboxer (Don "The Dragon" Wilson) trains with a master (Joe Marie Avellana) in Manila to avenge his brother in a tournament.

programme.title: Black Fox
programme.desc: A white homesteader's black blood brother is sent to negotiate the release of their families from their Indian captors.

programme.title: Black Fox: The Price of Peace
programme.desc: In 1860s Texas, a man whose abused wife fell in love with a Kiowa organizes a hunting party to recapture her.

programme.title: Bruce's Deadly Fingers
programme.desc: Malicious gangsters capture Bruce's former girlfriend, then a young martial artist attempts to rescue her and the late master's book containing lethal techniques for killing with a finger.

programme.title: The Clones of Bruce Lee
programme.desc: A brilliant professor gathers cells from the late Bruce Lee and constructs three perfect clones. Trained to be masters, the clones battle to stop criminals and smugglers.

programme.title: Sparkle
programme.desc: The demands of success take their toll on three Harlem sisters who reach the heights of musical stardom in the 1950s.

programme.title: Kenner
programme.desc: A U.S. seaman (Jim Brown) befriends an Indian boy (Ricky Cordell) and his mother (Madlyn Rhue) while hunting a killer in Bombay.

programme.title: ... Tick... Tick... Tick...
programme.desc: A newly elected sheriff (Jim Brown) gets help from his predecessor (George Kennedy) and the mayor (Fredric March) in a racially torn Southern town.

programme.title: Mr. Ricco
programme.desc: A San Francisco lawyer (Dean Martin) helps his client (Thalmus Rasulala) beat a murder rap marked by racial overtones.
